meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be preserved.
meanings.sent1: The preservability of the food in the fridge is impressive.
meanings.sent2: Preservability is essential when storing fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The preservability of the ancient artifact made the archaeologists happy.
meanings.sent4: Her preservability in the face of challenges is like a sturdy shield.
meanings.sent5: The preservability of memories in photographs is a precious gift.

meanings.definition: The ability to maintain freshness or quality over time.
meanings.sent1: Preservability of the canned goods is crucial for long-term storage.
meanings.sent2: The preservability of the flowers in the vase is remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The preservability of jokes depends on the audience's laughter.
meanings.sent4: His preservability in the music industry is like a timeless melody.
meanings.sent5: The preservability of friendships requires care and attention.
